description: T(n,k)=M0(n+1,k,f(n,k)), where M0(p,q,r)=number of upright paths from (0,0) to (1,0) to (p,p-q) that meet the line y=x-r and do not rise above it and f(n,k)=least t such that M0(n+1,k,f) is not 0.
comments: Let V-(e(1),...,e(n)) consist of q 1's, including e(1)=1 and p-q 0's; let V(h)=(e(1),...,e(h)) and m(h)=(#1's in V(h))-(#0's in V(h)) for h=1,...,n. Then M0(p,q,r)=number of V having r=max{m(h)}.f(n,k)=-1 if 0<=k<=[ (n-1)/2 ], else f(n,k)=2k-n.
author: _Clark Kimberling_
